\frac{d}{dx} \sin(x) = \cos(x) 
\quad and, in like manner- 
\frac{d}{dx} \cos(x) = -\sin(x). 

Again, \quad \frac{d}{dx} \sin(5x) = 5 \cos(5x) 
\quad since 5 multiplies the I.V. in the original function.

blocks.description: Derivatives of sine and cosine functions and their multiples.
Application of differentiation rules in a linear function.
The differentiation of tangent and its relationship to secant.
